parameters.name: filetype

http_get.details:
using of the http get function required of set options of
``http.cache_dir`` at first! The ``http.cache_dir`` could a directory folder
path to the local filesystem, or a reference symbol name in the global environment
for get a filesystem wrapper object.

parameters.name: streamTo
parameters.text:
A lambda function that accept a url and a parameter of file cache location.
this parameter should run http get request from the remote server and then
save file to local cache.

http_get.title: A general method for Http get request

paletteer_c.description:
Available package/palette combinations are available in the data.frame
\code{\link[paletteer]{palettes_c_names}}.

parameters.name: palette
parameters.text:
Name of palette as a string. Must be on the form
packagename::palettename.

parameters.name: n
parameters.text: Number of colors desired. Must be supplied.

parameters.name: direction
parameters.text: Either `1` or `-1`. If `-1` the palette will be reversed.

paletteer_c.title: Get continuous palette by package and name

page with given query expression value.

parameters.name: symbols
parameters.text:
a set of R# runtime symbols that defined from the R source script.
element data type of this parameter could be function, lambda function, character
symbols or something else which has symbol names.

parameters.name: outputdir

the directory path for export the help document for the R# runtime
symbols usually be the location of ``{package_dir}/vignettes/R``.

__RSymbolDocumentation.title: An internal helper function for generates html document for R# runtime symbols

__template.returns:
a tuple list that contains two template elements:
+ template: the html document template for the R# runtime symbols which is defined inside the R source script files.
+ clr_template: the html document template for the clr object which is exported from the .NET dll assembly files.
__template.title: An internal helper function for try to get the html document template

__sourcescript.description:
This function processes a collection of R script files or directories,
generating source commands for all identified R script files.
__sourcescript.details:
This function handles both individual R script files and directories.
For directories, it recursively scans for all files with .R or .r extensions.
File paths are normalized to ensure consistency across different platforms.

parameters.name: source
parameters.text:
A character vector of file paths or directory paths containing
R scripts to be loaded. If a directory path is provided, all
.R and .r files within it (recursively) will be included.

__sourcescript.returns:
A character string containing source commands for all identified
R script files, or a message indicating no dependencies were required.
The returned string can be evaluated to load all dependency scripts.
__sourcescript.title: An internal helper function for attaching dependency scripts

parameters.name: source
parameters.text: NULL

parameters.name: debug
parameters.text: FALSE

parameters.name: workdir
parameters.text: NULL

parameters.name: print.code
parameters.text: FALSE

parameters.name: native.R
parameters.text: 'getOption'('native_rexec')

rlang_interop.description:
This function facilitates interoperability between R# and native R
by translating R# closure expressions to native R code and executing it.
rlang_interop.details:
This function enables R# code to leverage native R functionality by
translating R# expressions to native R code and executing it through Rscript.
It handles both Windows and Linux environments automatically.

parameters.name: code
parameters.text: An R# managed closure expression to be converted and executed as native R code.

parameters.name: source
parameters.text: External dependency script file paths required for the execution environment.

parameters.name: debug
parameters.text: Logical indicating whether to debug the translation process (default: FALSE).

parameters.name: workdir
parameters.text: Working directory for executing the R script (default: current directory).

parameters.name: print_code
parameters.text: Logical indicating whether to print the generated R code (default: FALSE).

parameters.name: native_R
parameters.text: Path to custom Rscript executable (default: from options or system default).

rlang_interop.returns:
The result of executing the translated native R code, typically the output
of the R script execution.
rlang_interop.title: Helper function for R# language interoperability with R language

parameters.name: workdir
parameters.text: NULL

parameters.name: native.R
parameters.text: 'getOption'('native_rexec')

rlang_call.description: This function executes a native R script file using the system's Rscript executable.
rlang_call.details:
The function automatically detects the operating system and uses the
appropriate Rscript executable path for Windows or Linux systems.
It temporarily changes the working directory if specified, then restores
the original directory after execution.

parameters.name: script_code
parameters.text: File path to the target native R script file to be executed.

parameters.name: workdir
parameters.text: Working directory for executing the R script (default: current directory).

parameters.name: native_R
parameters.text: Path to custom Rscript executable (default: from options or system default).

rlang_call.returns:
This function returns nothing explicitly, but executes the R script and
may produce output, side effects, or results based on the script's contents.
rlang_call.title: Execute native R script from current R# process

parameters.name: source
parameters.text: NULL

parameters.name: debug
parameters.text: FALSE

transform_rlang_source.description: This function converts R# managed closure expressions to executable native R code.
transform_rlang_source.details:
This function is particularly useful for generating R scripts that can be executed
in environments like Docker containers or other isolated systems where R# might
not be available. The translation process preserves the functionality of the
original R# code while making it compatible with standard R interpreters. [9](@ref)

parameters.name: code
parameters.text: The R# managed closure expression code to be translated to native R code.

parameters.name: source
parameters.text: External dependency native R script file paths required for the translation.

parameters.name: debug
parameters.text: Logical indicating whether to debug the translation process (default: FALSE).

transform_rlang_source.returns:
A character string containing the complete native R script code that can be executed
by an R interpreter, including all dependency loading and the translated code.
transform_rlang_source.title: Translate R# code to native R script text
